title: What is the average high school day like in the US? - Quora

response.answer_text: I get up at around six thirty, and get dressed, eat breakfast, and get ready. At 7:20 I leave the house and drive to school which is about thirty minutes away. My school starts at eight so I wait ten or so minutes for it to start. My periods are an hour long and I have eight of them, in this order (this is my Monday schedule.) AP Geometry (8–9)French II (9–10)Art (10–11English (11–12)Lunch (11–12)Biology (12–1)Free period (1–2)Health (2–3)Then I get home at around three thirty. I go on social media for a bit, eat a quick snack, and then start my homework at four. Homework varies a lot so some days I’ll have an hour, and some days I’ll have three hours. On Mondays I usually only have an hour and a half, so I finish at about 5:30. Then I usually watch YouTube or a TV show while painting or drawing until dinner at around seven. Then after dinner I do whatever, or on heavier homework days I finish up homework after dinner, and then I go to bed at ten or eleven. Note: Monday is my easiest day, so on Wednesday and Thursday I often find myself going to bed at midnight or one and waking up late, and then doing homework for hours, sometimes even four hours.

This is what my typical day looks like : 6:00 AM : I'll wake up and start getting ready to go to school 6:45 AM : Off to school 7:00 AM : Gym class. One hour of weight training 5 days a week 8:00 AM : A 'zero' period of sorts. This is when attendance is taken and important stuff is announced 8:40 AM : First period starts. Each period is 40 mins long and there is a 5 min passing period in between each period to allow everyone to get to whatever class they want to. My first 4 periods are science on Mondays and Wednesdays. On other days I have my first science class during the first period and the second one during the third period. Period 2 and 4 are free on those days. 11:40 AM - 12:25 PM : My lunchtime can vary from 40 mins to 80 mins depending on the day. This is when I hangout with friends, catch up on some homework, study or even occasionally work out some more. 12:30 PM : History class. Boring material but great teacher.  1:15 PM : Another free period (seven). I typically take a nap during this period 1:55 PM - 3:25 PM : My last 2 periods of the day are Math and English. I'm exhausted by the end of English class and generally head home but on some days I have clubs I go to. This is my typical day in high school. I can't speak for the rest of the country, but this is what high school in Illinois looks like for me.
